attributes.title: The Story that Inspired This Hit TV Show | Franklin's Lost Expedition
attributes.caption: In 1845, the British sent out an expedition to find a way through the Northwest Passage. After two years of no contact, the expedition was deemed a failure.
attributes.description:
In 1845, the British sent out an expedition to find a way through the Northwest Passage. After two years of no contact, the expedition was deemed a failure. To this day, most of the crew has not been found and no one truly knows what happened. Let’s discuss the puzzling case of Franklin’s Lost Expedition.

Visit our Twitter page (http://Twitter.com/RedWebPod) for the relevant images discussed.

As we reference in the episode, this mystery was the inspiration behind season 1 of AMC's ""The Terror.""

Today, let’s discuss the investigation following the largest art theft of all time: the Gardner Museum Theft.

attributes.description:
When you’re sound asleep in the middle of the night, it’s impossible to know what’s going on in the world around you. Nearly a decade ago, a woman managed to record the sound of an unidentified voice, just a few feet from her bed. Today, we look into the unsettling story behind the Sleep as Android Incident.

Visit our Twitter page (http://Twitter.com/RedWebPod) to see the images we discuss.

Sponsored by HelloFresh (http://hellofresh.com/redweb16 + code redweb16) and ShipStation (http://shipstation.com + code REDWEB).

Download the audio version: https://bit.ly/3JfHDlP
attributes.display_title: Sleep App Captures Creepy Voice at Night | Sleep as Android Incident

attributes.title: The Eerie Question of Who Put Bella in the Wych Elm | Bella in the Wych Elm
attributes.caption: While exploring nearby woods, a group of teenage boys in the quiet town of Worcestershire, England, stumbled upon a gruesome scene - the skeleton of an unknown woman, stuffed into a tree. This woman became the talk of the town as investigators failed to identify who she was. Today, we begin our themed month with week one of Unsettling Forest Mysteries as we attempt to answer the chilling question: Who Put Bella in the Wych Elm?

attributes.title: The Most Famous UFO Sighting in England | Rendlesham Forest Incident
attributes.caption: After investigating what they thought was a crashed plane in the forest outside the Air Force base, a group of soldiers claimed to witness a UFO. Their sighting became one of the most well documented UFO cases ever, with some calling it Britain’s Roswell. Today we continue our theme with week 2 of Unsettling Forest mysteries as we discuss the Rendlesham Forest Incident.

attributes.title: Mysterious Sky Explosion Flattens Over 500,000 Acres of Forest | Tunguska Event
attributes.caption: On June 30th, 1908, an unprecedented event managed to flattened 800 square miles of pine trees in a Russian forest. Despite being the largest impact in history, the exact cause is still unknown. Today, we close out our themed month of unsettling forest mysteries as we discuss the strange and haunting Tunguska Event.

attributes.title: The Story Known as the "Moonshine Murders" | Brasher-Dye Disappearance
attributes.caption: During the height of the illegal moonshine trade, a pair of brothers and their cousin disappeared without a trace. attributes.title: The History of a Haunted Hospital | Pennhurst Asylum
attributes.caption: In 1987, Pennhurst State School & Hospital closed its doors after a documentary and multiple court cases revealed the horrible conditions patients were in. It is now one of the most haunted places in Pennsylvania. Today, we uncover the history and hauntings of what is now known as Pennhurst Asylum.

attributes.title: Family of Serial Killers Disappears | The Bloody Benders
attributes.caption: After the Civil War, a number of people went missing along the Osage trail in Kansas. Search parties tracked the disappearances to a family owned inn along the trail. When locals went to confront them about the situation, the family was gone. This week we discuss one of the most famous mysteries of the Old West, the Bloody Benders.

attributes.caption: In 1944 the small town of Mattoon, Illinois was in a panic for weeks. attributes.title: Why Did This Masked Individual Give Away Televisions Overnight? | Richmond TV Fairy
attributes.caption: In 2018, twenty people in Richmond, Virginia woke up to find TVs left on their doorsteps. No one knew why or who did it. attributes.title: Exploring the History of This Yuletide Creature | Krampus
attributes.caption: The month of December ushers in the holiday season. Typically a time of joy, celebration, and togetherness, a popular “face” of the holidays is Santa Claus. But there is another figure associated with the holidays with a much more sinister story. This half-goat, half-demon hunts naughty children and punishes them for their wrongdoings. Today, we embrace the holidays and take a look at the story of Krampus.
